title: T.J. Watt practices for 1st time since lung injury
content: The Steelers' T.J. Watt, two weeks removed from sustaining a partially punctured lung during a dry needling treatment and having subsequent reparative surgery, returned to practice for the first time Wednesday.

title: WR Rice among four Chiefs players placed on IR
content: Chiefs wide receiver Rashee Rice's 2025 season began with a suspension and now will end on injured reserve.

title: Kerr settles Draymond beef: 'Not my finest hour'
content: In a remarkable 15-minute media session Wednesday, Golden State Warriors coach Steve Kerr took responsibility for his argument with Draymond Green that caused the forward to leave the bench in the middle of a game.

title: Cards' Sweat irked by 'frustrating' Pro Bowl snub
content: Cardinals edge rusher Josh Sweat did not hold back his disappointment Wednesday in being named a Pro Bowl alternate this week.

title: Harbaugh denies rift, on 'A-plus' terms with Lamar
content: Responding to a column in The Baltimore Sun, Ravens coach John Harbaugh insisted on Wednesday that his relationship with quarterback Lamar Jackson is "A-plus."

title: Commanders to start QB Johnson vs. Cowboys
content: The Commanders will start 39-year-old Josh Johnson at quarterback for their Christmas Day home game against the Cowboys, coach Dan Quinn announced Wednesday.

title: Vikes' Kelly to IR after 3rd concussion of season
content: The Vikings placed center Ryan Kelly on injured reserve Wednesday, ending his season and possibly his career after he suffered his third concussion of the year.

title: üìà NBA Power Rankings: Young risers on all teams
content: From ROY and MIP races, our NBA insiders break down all 30 teams' young riser in this week's Power Rankings.

title: Five NBA games, three NFL games, one loaded Christmas Day slate: Everything you need to know
content: Christmas Day includes three NFL matchups and five NBA games. We're previewing them all with picks, predictions, storylines and more.

title: 'That's what we sign up for': Five tales -- and a few gripes -- from playing on Christmas
content: With NBA Christmas games on the horizon, stars and coaches share their stories and gripes about playing on the holiday.

content: Here's the latest, including intel on Burrow's future, opening QB1 spots, the Jaguars' legitimacy and Pro Bowl roster fallout.

title: NFL execs on how Tua Tagovailoa lost his edge and Mike McDaniel's support
content: What has gone wrong for Tagovailoa, what's the Dolphins' path forward and is there any interest in him?

title: How a random NFL drug test led to a cancer diagnosis: Alex Singleton's 'horrifying' past two months
content: The Broncos linebacker discovered he had testicular cancer from a league drug test. And now he plays the game with a fresh perspective.

title: The 50 best women's soccer players in the world for 2025, ranked!
content: Here are the 50 best women's soccer players in the world for 2025, as ranked by an expert panel of coaches, GMs and journalists.

title: A miracle child, a priceless penny and a racing legend
content: Back in 1998, long before the United States stopped producing the penny, a little girl with spina bifida gave Dale Earnhardt a gift that raises the question: What if pennies are actually worth everything?

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks for Christmas Day and all of Week 17
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Tracking the NFL playoff picture: Updated chances to clinch open spots, win division titles
content: We are following the 2025 NFL season's playoff picture. Here's how things look right now for wild-card spots, division races and even the draft order.

title: Bracketology: UConn supplants Duke as fourth No. 1 seed
content: The Huskies return to the top line as Duke drops to a 2-seed after suffering its first loss of the season.

title: Power Rankings: Should UConn or Texas be No. 1?
content: Texas has the best two-way point guard in the game. UConn might have the two best players in the nation.

title: Bracketology: Louisville up, Tennessee down as host battle heats up
content: A decisive win over Tennessee put Louisville solidly inside the top 16 -- and dropped the Lady Vols to a 6-seed.

title: Look out, Arsenal: Man City titles have been built on dominant midseason runs
content: Man City haven't been their typical best this season -- at least not yet, though the festive period is when their title wins have been built. Should Arsenal be worried?

title: Why and when the WNBPA executive committee might vote to strike
content: How and when would the WNBPA executive committee vote to strike? What would that entail? What benefits would be lost?

title: World Junior Championship guide: Top contenders, key players to watch
content: The tournament starts Thursday, with the best under-20 players in hockey. Here are gold medal favorites, players set to break out.

title: The NHL's best this week: Is Craig Berube on the hot seat in Toronto?
content: As the holiday break approaches, the Maple Leafs aren't exactly excelling. Plus, key games in the week ahead.

title: A 12-player blockbuster? Cy Young signings? Ranking the biggest MLB Christmas week moves
content: Who says the baseball offseason slows down for the holidays? Let's remember some free agent signings and trades.

title: Aggrieved fan index: The 10 fan bases in 2025 that have the right to be most frustrated
content: Who has reason for jeer this holiday season? We break down which teams' fans have the most reasons to be mad.

title: Best bets, DFS plays for the Christmas Day tripleheader: Edge to the road teams
content: Betting the Christmas Day games? Here are the odds, game picks, prop plays and daily fantasy tips for all three.

title: NBA betting: Two ways to get more value betting on the Thunder this season
content: Andre Snellings looks at the creative ways to bet the NBA's best team this season and still get value.

title: What's new heading into second season of TGL
content: From signature holes to a bigger and better putting green, the TGL is ready for the start of the 2026 season.

title: 'Tis the season for rating Christmas sweaters from top soccer teams!
content: Oh the weather outside is frightful, but the selection of knitwear that fans can wear to support their team this Christmas is so delightful.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Murillo, Ak√© in defensive push
content: Barcelona want Nottingham Forest defender Murillo or Manchester City's Nathan Ak√© on loan. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Odisha encounter: Top Maoist with Rs 1.2 crore bounty among 4 killed; arms seized
content: A significant blow to the Maoist insurgency occurred in Odisha's Kandhamal district as central committee member Ganesh Uike, with a Rs 1.2 crore bounty, was killed in an encounter. Security forces gunned down Uike and three associates in a forest, recovering weapons and ammunition.

title: MDMA, LSD, ecstasy pills: Woman techie & boyfriend held for selling high-end drugs
content: Hyderabad Narcotics Enforcement Wing arrested four individuals, including three alleged drug peddlers, in a drug network bust. Officials seized a significant quantity of drugs, including OG, MDMA, LSD blots, and ecstasy pills, valued at over Rs 3 lakh. The operation revealed a sophisticated network involving online procurement and cryptocurrency payments.

title: 'You don‚Äôt know me yet': Killers‚Äô chilling words before shooting Aligarh teacher; how events unfolded
content: A 45-year-old computer teacher, Rau Danish Ali, was fatally shot by two masked assailants on a two-wheeler while taking an evening walk on the AMU campus. The attackers fled the scene after firing at close range. Police are investigating the incident, with the family suggesting the victim may have known his attackers.

title: 'Sir, we have to evacuate ... ': Gadkari recalls meeting Hamas leader before killing; what followed next
content: Union minister Nitin Gadkari recounted meeting Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh hours before his assassination in Tehran. Gadkari, was in Iran, attending presidential swearing-in, and was informed of Haniyeh's death early next morning. The incident highlighted the growing role of technology in modern conflict and national security.

title: From ‚Äòresign now‚Äô to $9bn backing: Intel CEO‚Äôs Oval Office pitch
content: Donald Trump's demand for Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan's resignation over China ties dramatically shifted after a pivotal Oval Office meeting. Tan secured an $8.9 billion government investment, transforming Intel into a "too-strategic-to-fail" company, with the US taking a 9.9% stake in exchange for CHIPS Act funding.

title: Ashes 'drinking' row: 'I did exactly the same' ‚Äî former captain defends England players
content: England's Ashes tour faces off-field controversy after a mid-series break. Former captain Michael Vaughan urges restraint, stating the issue stems from cricket's ingrained drinking culture. He argues that players relaxing on days off often engage in similar behaviour. Vaughan believes this is a systemic problem across several cricketing nations, not an individual failing.

title: Rich Indians rush to transfer money abroad as rupee falls, banks expand regulations
content: Indian banks are intensifying scrutiny on overseas money transfers, demanding detailed proof of fund origins from individuals and businesses. This heightened caution, particularly for remittances from NRO accounts, arises amid the rupee's slide and increased customer urgency to move funds abroad, leading to compliance hurdles.

title: 'Chanukah' sign car set ablaze in Melbourne days after Bondi beach shooting
content: A car adorned with a "Happy Chanukah" sign was deliberately set ablaze in Melbourne, prompting an investigation into a potential antisemitic attack. While no injuries were reported, the incident has heightened fears within the Jewish community, following a recent mass shooting at a Hanukkah festival.

title: Telegram founder‚Äôs IVF pledge: 100+ children, $17bn promise; DNA proof required
content: Telegram founder Pavel Durov offered to fund IVF treatments using his donated sperm, promising an equal share of his $17 billion fortune to any children who can prove their DNA connection. Having fathered over 100 children globally, Durov stated his donations aimed to address a worldwide sperm shortage. He plans to open-source his DNA to help his offspring connect.

title: Candidates 2026: 'Praggnanandhaa is third favourite' - World No. 1 Carlsen
content: World No. 1 and five-time World Champion Magnus Carlsen has named Americans Hikaru Nakamura and Fabiano Caruana as favourites for the 2026 Candidates, with India‚Äôs R Praggnanandhaa as the third contender. Praggnanandhaa is the only Indian among eight players competing to challenge World Champion D Gukesh. The tournament starts on March 28 in Cyprus.

title: B'day outing turns nightmare: IT manager 'gang raped' in CEO‚Äôs car; survivor recall horror
content: A private IT company manager alleged gang-rape by her CEO and an executive's husband in a moving car after a company party. The survivor claims she was drugged and molested by the CEO and raped by the executive's husband while the executive head was present. All three accused have been detained for questioning.

title: VHT: 'I get fans' frustration, but‚Ä¶' - Ashwin explains why matches weren't televised
content: Fans' frustration over limited Vijay Hazare Trophy TV coverage is understandable, says Ravichandran Ashwin.  While stars like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are lighting up the tournament with centuries, many matches remain unwatched. Ashwin explained that broadcasting schedules are set far in advance, making last-minute telecasts difficult despite the players' presence.

title: Nvidia may have just admitted that it cannot take Amazon, Google & Microsoft in Cloud
content: Nvidia has shelved its ambitious plan to directly challenge cloud giants like Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. The chipmaker is now refocusing its DGX Cloud division inward, prioritizing its own engineers' AI model development. This strategic pivot aims to protect Nvidia's dominant AI chip market share, estimated at over 80%, rather than pursuing cloud revenue.

title: Fast food at train stations? Haldiram, WoW Momos & more plan setup at platforms
content: Fast-food giants like McDonald's and KFC are set to open outlets at Indian railway stations, with the first expected in 2026. This move aims to elevate passenger experience to airport standards, offering significant sales potential. Brands will secure five-year licenses through e-auctions, potentially boosting Indian Railways' non-fare revenue.

title: Dhurandhar box office: Ranveer Singh film crosses Rs 600 crore mark
content: Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar' continues its impressive box office run, crossing Rs 600 crore despite competition from 'Avatar Fire And Ash'. Meanwhile, Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday's 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' faces a slow start with limited shows and dull advance bookings, indicating a challenging opening.

title: Who is Sebastian Telfair? Ex-NBA guard freed after prison stint with Diddy
content: Sebastian Telfair was released from federal prison after serving time for a probation violation linked to the NBA health care fraud case. The former Thunder guard served his sentence at Fort Dix, the same prison housing Sean ‚ÄúDiddy‚Äù Combs. Telfair spoke about Combs‚Äô mindset behind bars and is now shifting focus toward a return to basketball through Ice Cube‚Äôs Big3 league.

title: No baraats, no brides, no beginnings: Inside India's ‚ÄòHamlet of Bachelors‚Äô
content: Barwan Kalan, a remote Bihar village, is dubbed the "hamlet of bachelors" as lack of roads, water, and electricity has prevented marriages for over 50 years. Despite being near tourist spots, residents face isolation, with basic services like hospitals and schools miles away.

title: VHT: Applaud, but heed bigger picture - Suryavanshi exposes domestic cricket's imbalance
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi shattered List A records with a 190 off 84 balls, including the fastest 150, as Bihar posted a mammoth 574/6. This performance, alongside other centuries in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, highlights a growing concern over the competitive balance in domestic cricket, particularly with the inclusion of newer northeastern teams.

title: India to miss $1 trillion exports target? Exports struggle despite the FTA push
content: India's ambitious $1 trillion export target by FY26 appears out of reach, with weak global demand and protectionism hindering merchandise shipments. While services exports offer a cushion, trade deals with the US and EU could be crucial. Diversification is underway, but a shift towards higher-tech products is needed for sustained growth.

title: CAT 2025 results: 12 candidates score 100 percentile; 9 from non-engineering backgrounds
content: CAT 2025 results have been announced by IIM Kozhikode, with 12 candidates achieving a perfect 100 percentile. Of these, nine are from non-engineering backgrounds, reflecting academic diversity among top scorers. The exam saw participation from 2.58 lakh candidates, with a balanced gender and category-wise representation. Delhi emerged as the leading state among 100 percentile scorers. IIMs and 93 non-IIM institutions will now begin their admission shortlisting processes.

title: Bangladesh unrest: Ex-PM Zia‚Äôs son Tarique returns after 17 yrs in exile ‚Äî why it matters
content: Tarique Rahman, BNP's acting chief, returns to Bangladesh after 17 years in exile, poised to lead the party in upcoming elections. His return follows legal acquittals and amid a reshaped political landscape after Sheikh Hasina's ouster. Rahman's re-entry signals a significant shift, with the BNP now a frontrunner.

title: Income tax refund: Your refund may be delayed if revised return not filed by Dec 31
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25: The Income Tax Department is stepping up scrutiny on tax returns, leading to delays in refunds for many taxpayers. A NUDGE campaign is urging taxpayers whose deduction or exemption claims have been deemed ineligibile.

title: A hidden Arctic world: Methane mounds and life found 3.6 km below the Greenland Sea
content: Scientists have found a unique geological and biological complex deep in the Greenland Sea.  Methane hydrate mounds, formed by trapped methane and ice, were discovered along the Molloy Ridge.  These mounds support chemosynthetic organisms, life that thrives without sunlight.  This discovery offers new insights into Arctic oceanography and methane stability.

title: From cars to foreign trips: Freebie fest peaks in Pune civic polls; experts warn of new trend
content: Political aspirants in Pune are escalating campaign strategies for local polls, offering high-value inducements like Paithani saris, vehicles, land plots, and even holiday trips. This shift from traditional outreach to extravagant giveaways signals a fiercely contested civic race driven by competition and a focus on visibility over ideology.

title: Karnataka crash: Fuel tanker jumped divider, hit bus head-on; how a split-second collision turned fatal
content: A horrific accident on NH-48 saw a fuel tanker collide with a sleeper bus, igniting a blaze that claimed at least nine lives. The tanker jumped the divider, engulfing the bus in flames and trapping passengers. Rescue efforts are ongoing, with the death toll expected to rise. The tanker driver perished, while some bus occupants escaped.

title: 'Bauna' remark: 'Pant, Bumrah apologised' ‚Äî Bavuma says 'you don't forget what is said'
content: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma has revealed that Indian players Jasprit Bumrah and Rishabh Pant apologized for an on-field comment made during the first Test. Bavuma, initially unaware of the remark, stated that while such incidents are part of intense cricket, words spoken are not easily forgotten. He emphasized that despite the heated exchanges, mutual respect between players remained intact.

title: Hymns, carols, morning prayers: How PM Modi celebrated Christmas ‚Äî see pics, watch video
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi extended Christmas greetings, wishing for peace, compassion, and hope, and called for societal harmony. He attended a Christmas morning service at The Cathedral Church of the Redemption in Delhi, highlighting the enduring values of love and brotherhood. This follows his consistent engagement with the Christian community through various events.

title: Christmas miracle: Man slips from 10th floor; gets stuck on 8th floor window grill
content: A Surat man had a miraculous escape after falling from his 10th-floor apartment window and getting caught in an 8th-floor grill. Firefighters swiftly responded, cutting through the grill and using ropes to safely rescue the 57-year-old. He sustained injuries and was hospitalized following the dramatic incident.

title: 75+ Merry Christmas messages, greetings, wishes and quotes
content: Christmas offers a welcome pause, emphasizing connection, kindness, and genuine joy. This season's significance stems from its roots in hope and renewal, expanding to universal themes of togetherness and generosity. Thoughtful messages, whether for family, friends, or colleagues, carry deep emotion and foster meaningful connections.

title: Ashes: Ravi Shastri the next England coach? Ex-cricketer explains why he fits the bill
content: Following England's Ashes struggles, former spinner Monty Panesar has proposed Ravi Shastri as the next head coach. Panesar highlighted Shastri's success in leading India to back-to-back Border-Gavaskar Trophy wins in Australia, emphasising his understanding of how to conquer the hosts on their home turf. This suggestion comes as Brendon McCullum faces increasing pressure despite his initial impact.

title: Shimla doctor, who thrashed patient sacked; govt finds act 'unbecoming of a public servant'
content: Himachal Pradesh government has terminated the services of Dr. Raghav Nirula, a senior resident doctor at IGMC Shimla, for assaulting a patient. An inquiry committee found his actions unbecoming of a public servant, leading to his dismissal under the Resident Doctor Policy 2025. The incident involved a scuffle with a patient, and an FIR has been lodged.

title: 'Fastest ramp-up': Rahul hails 'transformative job creation' in K'taka; minister fires cheeky retort
content: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw lauded Rahul Gandhi for acknowledging Foxconn's significant job creation in Karnataka, attributing it to Prime Minister Modi's 'Make in India' initiative. Gandhi highlighted the rapid hiring of 30,000 staff, predominantly young women, at the new iPhone assembly unit, emphasizing the creation of dignified jobs and opportunities for all, setting an example for India's manufacturing growth.

title: Will AI wipe out jobs or create exciting new market? What OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman paints a striking picture of the future of work. While AI may wipe out many traditional jobs, he believes it will also create thrilling, high-paying opportunities‚Äîsome so futuristic they could involve space exploration. For today‚Äôs graduates, Altman says the timing couldn‚Äôt be better‚Äîthey‚Äôre stepping into a career landscape unlike anything we‚Äôve seen before.

title: 'National total war': How China's military buildup up is making US more vulnerable
content: A new Pentagon report reveals China's military buildup increasingly threatens the US homeland. Beijing is developing capabilities for direct attacks on critical infrastructure, cyber systems, and space assets, aiming to disrupt American decision-making during a Taiwan crisis. This signifies a shift from regional deterrence to direct homeland vulnerability, fundamentally altering US defense calculations.

title: First day at Navi Mumbai Airport? Flights, routes and connectivity ‚Äî here‚Äôs what travelers need to know
content: Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA) officially opens its doors for commercial operations today, offering a second air travel gateway for the Mumbai Metropolitan Region. Initially, four airlines will operate around 30 domestic flights daily between 8 am and 8 pm, with plans to expand to 24-hour operations by February 2026.

title: Unfinished wall, 'porous' passenger area: What's delaying Noida airport inauguration? Gaps flagged
content: Noida International Airport faces delays due to an unfinished perimeter wall and 'porous' passenger areas, raising security concerns. Bomb disposal equipment also awaits certification. A review by the aviation secretary will assess readiness, with a Christmas decision expected on its operational timeline. Foreign CEO clearance is also being addressed.

title: Gold & silver price prediction: Precious metals at new highs - where are prices headed ?
content: Gold and silver price prediction: Gold prices are poised to continue their upward trajectory, with MCX Gold showing strong bullish momentum and potential to reach 145,000. Silver also displays significant strength, having broken out of consolidation and targeting 240,000.

title: Aravali hills row: Centre to increase mining-free zones amid protests
content: The Union environment ministry is expanding prohibited mining areas in the Aravali hills following Supreme Court directives and public protests. The ministry has asked a central institution to identify additional zones for mining bans, aiming to further protect the mountain range's ecology and biodiversity.

title: This Christmas, when you‚Äôre with loved ones, don‚Äôt forget to have these 7 health conversations
content: During holiday festivities, families can take advantage of the opportunity to engage in meaningful discussions about health. While the season is filled with joy and celebration, it‚Äôs also a perfect time to delve into topics such as family medical history, mental wellness, healthy habits, and the importance of preventive care.

title: Paul Rudd reacts to Travis Kelce‚Äôs emotional apology after Chiefs playoff loss
content: Actor Paul Rudd shared his perspective on the Kansas City Chiefs' season. He highlighted the joy and memories the team has provided his family. Rudd embraced the team's elimination from playoff contention. He wished Patrick Mahomes a speedy recovery. Rudd also humorously suggested players deserved a break after a long season. He stated he was not too upset.

title: Taylor Swift opens up about cancer scare and Travis Kelce‚Äôs support
content: Taylor Swift opened up about a painful chapter during the Eras Tour, revealing how a backup singer‚Äôs cancer diagnosis deeply shook her tour family. The experience marked an emotional low point, but Swift said she later found renewed joy and stability in her personal life, crediting Travis Kelce with bringing light and happiness after an incredibly difficult period.

title: Randi Mahomes hosts holiday giveaway as Patrick Mahomes battles injury
content: The Kansas City Chiefs are navigating a difficult season, and quarterback Patrick Mahomes is sidelined with a significant injury. Amid this challenging time, Patrick Mahomes' mother, Randi Mahomes, is focusing on a different mission which is to support families raising young athletes.

title: What happens to human skin under space sunlight
content: Astronauts do not need sunscreen in space because their advanced spacesuits and spacecraft windows are designed to block harmful UV radiation. These engineered protections, rather than topical lotions, ensure safety from the Sun's harsh rays during extravehicular activities and inside habitats. A rare suit tear did cause one astronaut sunburn, highlighting the critical role of this technology.

title: 'Was inside our territory': Cambodia accuses Thailand of demolishing Lord Vishnu statue
content: Cambodia accused Thailand of destroying a Lord Vishnu statue in a disputed border area, amid renewed clashes that have killed over 40 and displaced nearly a million. Both sides blame each other for the violence, while diplomatic talks remain stalled.

title: Stock market holiday: Are NSE, BSE open for trading on December 25?
content: Stock markets will observe a Christmas holiday on December 25th, marking the year's final trading closure. Normal operations resume December 26th. Looking ahead to 2026, exchanges have unveiled a calendar featuring trading holidays, including Republic Day, Holi, and Diwali, with a special Muhurat Trading session planned.

title: NFL playoff-clinching scenarios: What's at stake for nine teams in Week 17?
content: eight more teams punched their ticket into the postseason during week 16 of 2025 . 10 of 14 teams have qualified for the playoffs with two weeks to go . five AFC teams and four NFC teams have a chance to secure something this week .

title: Points league rankings: Michael Porter Jr. vaults into top 20
content: the fantasy basketball head-to-head points league player rankings are updated regularly throughout the season based on player performances, injuries, trades, signings and other trends . he has moved up into the top-20 in the points rankings . his 25.6 PPG, 7.4 RPG and 3.3 APG would mark career highs for MPJ .

title: Power Rankings: Kentucky, Seton Hall crack top 25
content: Kentucky dropped out of these Power Rankings back on Dec. 4 . the Wildcats lost by 35 points to Gonzaga in Nashville on tuesday . a complete roster looks very much like a top-25 team, if the second half is any indication .

title: The 25 most college football moments of the 21st century
content: college football slips so easily into pure chaos after all the on-field heroics . college football is a celebration not of the sublime but of the ridiculous . it has to be a little bit weird, colorless, color-coded moment .

title: 2026 NFL Pro Bowl AFC, NFC rosters: The league's top players
content: the rosters are set for the 2026 NFL Pro Bowl Games . the Baltimore Ravens, Denver Broncos , San Francisco 49ers and Seattle Seahawks lead the way with each having six players chosen . this year's games include a skills competition and a 7-on-7 flag football game scheduled for Feb. 3 .

title: We made score picks for every postseason CFB game
content: the 12-team college football playoff is no longer new . there are more justifiably aggrieved teams at being left out . the annual coaching carousel always impacts the postseason . new coach Pete Golding will make his debut in the biggest game in team history .

title: Why believe in Tyler Shough, Malik Willis and other unlikely playoff starters?
content: a new year threatens to begin before you've processed the entirety of the one that you're still navigating . the month of December rolled out at an excruciating pace . there are a variety of pocketed countdown calendars replete with surprises like chocolates or crystals .

title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
content: the transfer window opens in early January across the premier league , german Bundesliga , French Ligue 1 , Spanish LaLiga and Italian Serie A . but clubs have been busy planning their business for months . arsenal's summer spend was so comprehensive that they now have the best squad depth in England .

title: Which of these eight midfield targets fits best at Man United?
content: the need for a new midfield partner in the center of Ruben Amorim's midfield is more pressing than ever . the midfielder's recent comments suggest that united may even have two midfield roles to fill soon . however, sources say at least seven midfielders were under consideration .

title: 'If I don‚Äôt get this right, my career is over': How Penn State landed on Matt Campbell as its next coach
content: Matt Campbell is new coach for the first time in 58 days as head coach . the 46-year-old had become Iowa State's all-time coaching wins leader . he had spent much of his childhood following Nittany Lions football while visiting grandparents .

title: US Says Over Million More Documents Related To Epstein Under Review
content: The US Department of Justice said Wednesday that more than a million more documents potentially related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have been discovered and are being reviewed for release.

title: Kim Jong Un Visits Nuke Subs, Gets "Invincible Friendship" Message From Russia
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un visited a nuclear submarine factory and received a message from Russia's Vladimir Putin hailing the countries' "invincible friendship", Pyongyang's state media said Thursday.

title: "Papa, I'm In Pain": Indian Man Dies After 8-Hour Wait At Canada Hospital
content: A 44-year-old Indian-origin man has died of suspected cardiac arrest after he reportedly did not receive any treatment for several hours at a hospital in Canada.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla Got 2 Wisdown Teeth Extracted Before Space Travel
content: Dental health is extremely important for astronauts, Shubhanshu Shukla, the first Indian to reach the International Space Station, has said, recalling that he had two wisdom teeth extracted while preparing for his space journey.

title: India Tests K-4 Missile, With 3,500-km Range, From Nuclear-Powered Submarine
content: In a big flex of its nuclear capabilities, India has tested an intermediate-range ballistic missile launched from a nuclear-capable submarine.

title: Top Maoist Ganesh Uike, With Rs 1.1 Crore Bounty, Among 4 Killed In Odisha
content: Security forces in Odisha neutralised a top Telugu Maoist commander on Thursday. Ganesh Uikey, 69, a high-ranking central committee member of the CPI (Maoist) and head of its Odisha operations was killed by teams of the BSF and the CRPF.

title: Tarique Rahman's 'Bulletproof' Entry In Dhaka, Lakhs Gather To Welcome Him
content: Thousands of people in Bangladesh took to the streets on Thursday to welcome Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) acting chairman Tarique Rahman, who landed in Dhaka, ending more than 17 years of self-exile in the United Kingdom.

title: Death Of China's 'One Child Policy' Ex-Chief Sees Less Tributes, More Criticism
content: The death of a former head of China's one-child policy has been met not by tributes but by castigation of the abandoned policy on social media this week.

title: Bangladesh Election: The Hindu Candidate Running For Sheikh Hasina's Seat And His Opponents
content: Amid ongoing atrocities against minorities, a Hindu man is seeking to win people's mandate from the ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's constituency in the upcoming national elections.

title: "I Tried, But...": Karnataka Driver Recounts Moment Truck Crashed Into Bus
content: At least 10 people were burnt alive in a highway tragedy in Karnataka early this morning. A luxury private bus caught fire on National Highway-48 after a speeding truck rammed it in Chitradurga, trapping the sleeping passengers around 2 am.

title: Car With Hanukkah Sign Set On Fire In Melbourne Days After Bondi Attack
content: Australian police are investigating a "suspicious fire" after a car carrying a sign celebrating the Jewish festival of Hanukkah was set ablaze Thursday in Melbourne.

title: Reunion Of Thackeray Brothers To Protect Marathi Manoos' Welfare: Shiv Sena
content: Shiv Sena Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray said while many alliances and coalitions have occurred in politics, tie-up between Shiv Sena led by Uddhav Thackeray and Maharashtra Navnirman Sena founded by Raj Thackeray is set to be historic.

title: Toxic Syrup Survivor, 5, Returns Home After 115 Days, But Without Eyesight
content: In a tragedy that claimed the lives of 24 children across Madhya Pradesh after they consumed a poisonous cough syrup, a five-year-old boy from Chhindwara has returned home after a 115-day battle for survival.

title: Rs 5 Thali At 100 Atal Canteens In Delhi From Today: See What's On Menu
content: Commemorating the 101st birth anniversary of Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee, Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta launched 100 Atal Canteens aimed at providing food with dignity to the poor, labourers, and low-income families.

title: Drug-Addict Jalandhar Man Crosses India-Pak Border, Detained, Family Appeals For Help
content: A man from Punjab's Jalandhar, who is addicted to drugs, crossed the India-Pakistan border and was detained by the Pakistani Rangers.

title: Woman Techie Sold Drugs With Boyfriend, Busted By Hyderabad Cops
content: A 21-year-old woman software engineer, her partner, and two other men have been arrested in connection with a drug network in Hyderabad. A significant quantity of drugs has also been seized during a raid, including cannabis, LSD, and ecstasy pills.

title: Door Handles Of Tesla's Model 3 Face Renewed Scrutiny By US
content: Tesla Inc's door handles are facing renewed scrutiny in the US after federal auto safety regulators opened a probe into the emergency releases in certain Model 3 vehicles.

title: Pak Agency's Role In Fanning Anti-India Sentiment In Bangladesh Likely: Report
content: The ISI's role in attempting to fan an anti-India sentiment in Bangladesh is most certainly confirmed, given the rhetoric by some Pakistan news outlets and a few leaders.

title: Lawrence Bishnoi's Jailed Brother Picks Up Religious Books, Surya Namaskar
content: Did the time in jail, which has only been a few days so far, give a pause and a chance to gangster Anmol Bishnoi, the brother of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, to reflect on his deeds?

title: Doncic, Reaves and the hilarious bromance fueling the Lakers' wild start
content: the 8,000-sQUARE-FOOT Manhattan Beach mansion was designed with a minimalist motif . the five-bedroom home was built from tennis star Maria Sharapova . it features a premium man cave amenity that doubles as an irresistible lure for competition junkies .

title: Hawai'i caps rally with last-minute TD to stun Cal
content: backup quarterback Luke Weaver threw a 22-yard touchdown pass to Nick Cenacle with 10 seconds left . weaver entered the game after Micah Alejado took a hard hit on the previous play . he led his program to its first nine-win season since 2019 .

title: MVPs for every bowl game: Micah Alejado helps Hawai'i erase 21-point deficit
content: the 2025 bowl season is in full swing and college football experts are here to highlight the best performances from bowl season . we'll pick MVPs from each of the 36 bowl games from Dec. 13 to Jan. 2 . quarterback micah Alejado proved to be the best quarterback on the field Wednesday .

title: Karnataka bus accident: Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy attributes fire to truck hitting bus near fuel tank
content: As many as five persons died after a container truck hit a sleeper bus on National Highway 48 near Hiriyur in Chitradurga district early on December 25

title: Journalist found dead in her house in Mizoram
content: Ezrela Dalidia Fanai, 41, was a freelance journalist who had worked with several national media houses over the years. She lived alone in the house after her mother passed away in July, police said

title: Majority‚Äôs strength lies in ensuring minorities live without fear: T.N. CM Stalin
content: In a post on X, Mr. Stalin said when a few right-wing violent groups, acting in the name of the majority, indulge in attacks and riots, even as the Prime Minister participates in Christmas celebrations, it sends a disturbing message to the nation

title: Exports of Narsapuram crochet lace products cross ‚Çπ150-crore mark
content: GI tag, design and development by the International Lace Trade Centre are prime driving forces for the craft to back on the track.

title: Lokayukta raids properties linked to IAS officer Sarfaraz Khan
content: Officials unearthed movable and immovable assets worth ‚Çπ14.38 crore during searches at 13 properties linked to Mr. Khan.

title: Gujarat ACB books IAS officer and ex-Surendranagar collector on ED‚Äôs complaint
content: On December 23, an ED team conducted searches and arrested deputy mamlatdar (revenue officer) Chandrasinh Mori, posted at the Surendranagar district collector's office, after recovering ‚Çπ67.5 lakh from his home for his alleged role in a bribery-linked money laundering case.

title: Karnataka bus accident: Four bus passengers, truck driver die in collision near Chitradurga
content: Around 2 a.m., the truck carrying beverages from Maharashtra to Nelamangala near Bengaluru jumped over the road divider and hit the oncoming private sleeper bus heading to Gokarna

title: India entered semiconductor industry a bit late, but it will soon start exporting: Amit Shah
content: We have made a strong entry into the semiconductor industry, although a bit late. In no time, we will not only become self-reliant in the semiconductor sector, but will also start exporting it, says Union Home Minister Amit Shah

title: Police organise mega medical camp for tribals in Velairupadu Agency Area
content: In addition to conducting medical examinations, free medicines were distributed to all needy patients

title: Leopard cub found dead during reunion attempt near Marudhamalai in Coimbatore
content: The cub, rescued on Wednesday (December 24) from a house at the Marudhamalai foothills, was placed in a cave-like structure built using natural rocks in the adjoining forest area

title: Study indicates need for integrated centres for assessment of breast cancer
content: The analysis by the Chennai Breast Centre revealed that when tests are conducted across multiple centres in a fragmented manner, a significant proportion of breast cancer diagnoses is missed or misdiagnosed

title: Watch: Karnataka bus-truck crash sparks massive fire on NH-48 near Chitradurga
content: At least 5 people were killed after a container truck rammed into a luxury sleeper bus on National Highway 48 near Hiriyur in Karnataka‚Äôs Chitradurga district early on December 25.

content: She also instructed officials to provide details of nearby temples and tourist destinations in the form of a ‚Äútourism circuit‚Äù to visitors participating in the festival, enabling them to explore other attractions in the region after attending the event

title: Unnao rape case: Plea filed in Supreme Court against suspension of Sengar's jail term
content: The Advocates Anjale Patel and Pooja Shilpkar contended that the High Court passed the order without considering that the trial court observed that Sengar must remain in jail for the rest of his natural life

title: Karnataka bus accident: Hiriyur Rural police register FIR against truck driver
content: Several persons died when the truck jumped the divider and hit an oncoming private sleeper bus in Chitradurga district in Karnataka on December 25

title: Karnataka bus accident: Private school bus driver lauded for averting another tragedy
content: The driver witnessed the accident in which a truck hit a private sleeper leading to loss of several lives, in Chitradurga district on December 25

title: India‚Äôs easternmost village in Arunachal to host first Sunrise Festival
content: Anjaw district‚Äôs Dong is a habitation that receives the first rays of the sun in the country every day

content: An intense cold wave continued to grip Punjab, Haryana and Rajasthan, with Rajasthan‚Äôs Fatehpur in Sikar district emerging as the coldest place at 1.6 degrees Celsius, according to the India Meteorological Department.

title: PM Modi visit Vajpayee's memorial ‚ÄòSadaiv Atal‚Äô; pay tributes
content: Vajpayee, India's 13th Prime Minister, served the country for three terms between 1996 and 2004;  Modi said Vajpayee dedicated his entire life to good governance and nation-building

title: School teacher shot dead on Aligarh Muslim University campus
content: AMU Proctor Mohammad Waseem Ali identified the deceased as Rao Danish Ali, a teacher at ABK Union High School, affiliated with the university

title: Arudra Darshan festival at Chidambaram Natarajar temple begins with flag hoisting
content: The highlights of the festival are the car procession on January 2, 2026 and the Arudra Darshan festivities on January 3.

title: Mayawati expresses concern over 'anti-India and anti-Hindu incidents' in Bangladesh
content: The way Hindu minorities in Bangladesh are being harassed by targeting their life, property and religion has created a wave of concern not only in our country but also elsewhere, says BSP president Mayawati

title: What qualifies as ‚Äòtea‚Äô? FSSAI clarifies
content: The food safety regulatory body issued a clarification saying a beverage qualifies to be tea only if it is derived from the plant Camellia sinensis

title: AP Government hands over key R&B roads in Guntur to Municipal Corporation for maintenance
content: The total length of roads handed over runs into several kilometres, covering critical urban traffic corridors

title: No connection between PMs 'global talk and local walk' on environment, says Congress
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh accused the government of launching a determined assault on ecological balance by weakening environmental protection laws and loosening pollution norms.

title: India engaged with U.S. to find mutually beneficial trade pact: Kwatra
content: Indian Ambassador to the U.S., Vinay Mohan Kwatra, termed India‚Äôs successful launch of an American communication satellite on Wednesday as a ‚Äúvery important and big day‚Äù for the partnership between Washington and New Delhi

title: Top Maoist leader Ganesh Uike, five others killed in gunfights in Odisha
content: With this major breakthrough, Odisha stands at the threshold of becoming completely free from Maoism, says Home Minister Amit Shah

title: Kerala marks Christmas with prayers, voices concern over attacks
content: Calling for peace, Major Archbishop of the Malankara Catholic Church Cardinal Baselios Cleemis urged people to pray for those spreading hatred and appealed to those in power to govern with justice and a sense of responsibility

title: PM Modi attends Christmas service at Delhi church, greets citizens
content: The service included prayers, carols, hymns and a special prayer for the Prime Minister by Rt. Rev. Dr. Paul Swarup, the Bishop of Delhi.

title: VHP activists vandalises Assam school, burns items from shops to protest Christmas celebration
content: The activists entered the St Mary's School of Panigaon village and vandalised the preparation of the Christmas Day programme. They burnt down the banner and posters of the celebration, a police official said.

title: KDEM-FKCCI combine to drive cluster-based development beyond Bengaluru
content: The collaboration will leverage FKCCI‚Äôs network of over 30 district chambers, alongside KDEM‚Äôs cluster-led ecosystem initiatives, to drive MSME digitisation, startup growth, investment readiness, and entrepreneurship across non-metro districts in Karnataka

content: The Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA) began operations, with the first flight from Bengaluru, operated by IndiGo, touching down the runway at 8 a.m..

title: Catholic Bishops‚Äô chief appeals to PM Modi, Amit Shah to ensure protection of Christians
